item.title: Covid in Scotland: Nicola Sturgeon optimistic major restrictions will end
item.description: The first minister is due to announce next week whether most remaining restrictions will be lifted on 9 August.

item.title: Flooding concerns amid heavy rain and thunderstorms
item.description: The Met Office issues an amber warning for thunderstorms covering a large part of the country.

item.title: 'Luxury' race will be among most expensive on earth
item.description: A four-day ultramarathon covering 120 miles on the west coast of Scotland will cost £15,499 to enter.

item.title: Priest attacked by man with bottle in Edinburgh cathedral
item.description: The priest was sitting alone praying when he was assaulted in St Mary's Cathedral in Edinburgh.

item.title: Scottish boy plucked from obscurity stars in Indian film Mimi on Netflix
item.description: Three-year-old Jacob Smith of Aberdeen was plucked from obscurity on holiday and cast with Kriti Sanon in Mimi.

item.title: Teenager dies and three others hurt in A96 crash
item.description: An 18-year-old man died at the scene in Moray while a 23-year-old was said to be critically injured.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Scott wins Scotland's first Tokyo medal as Murray reaches doubles quarter-finals
item.description: Duncan Scott wins Scotland first medal of the Tokyo Games and makes history in the pool for Team GB, while there's progress for Andy Murray among others.

item.title: Post-lockdown rise in harassment of dolphins
item.description: Conservationists say there has been a rise in boat traffic-related disturbance of the protected species.

item.title: Air traffic controllers strike to shut six Hial airports
item.description: Inverness, Sumburgh and Dundee are among the airports affected by a dispute over changes to air traffic control.

item.title: Kayaker aged 77 in lifeboat rescue after fall on island off Skye
item.description: The woman fell as she stepped ashore at Guillamon Island near Broadford Bay on Skye.

item.title: Covid risk 'eight times higher' for shielding group, study shows
item.description: A study has shown people advised to shield were also five times more likely to die from the virus.

item.title: Shetland fires 'should act as warning to modular building industry'
item.description: Two devastating fires involved buildings made from factory-built units brought up to islands by sea.

item.title: Fresh bid to save McVitie's biscuit factory from closure
item.description: Nearly 500 jobs are at risk at the factory in the east end of Glasgow, which opened almost 100 years ago.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules at level zero?
item.description: The whole of Scotland has now moved to level zero, but what does that actually mean people can do?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?
item.description: The documents could be used in an international vaccine passport programme enabling foreign travel.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: What happened to Scotland's 'free from Covid' hopes?
item.description: In summer 2020, there was talk of being "not far away" from eliminating the virus. That did not happen, but is there still cause for optimism?

item.title: Does political pressure shape pandemic decisions?
item.description: With Scotland and England on the road out of lockdown, does political pressure encourage a "four nation" approach?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Can we stop worrying about high case numbers?
item.description: As vaccination reduces serious illness from Covid-19, the Scottish government is changing its strategy.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What level is your area in?
item.description: Many Scottish council areas saw restrictions ease earlier this month, but some remained at the same level.

item.title: Long Covid: 'I don't feel 23 anymore, I feel so much older'
item.description: Heather Campbell tested positive for the virus in November, six months after starting her nursing career.

item.title: The repair shop trying to fix throwaway culture
item.description: A social enterprise has opened up shop in Glasgow to encourage communities to repair and reuse their possessions.

item.title: Geek Retreat rolls the dice on smaller town stores
item.description: The Scottish games café company is expanding its number of sites rapidly despite the pandemic.

item.title: Martin Compston: 'Scotland's Justin Bieber' leads cast of The Rig
item.description: Martin Compston's latest co-star reckons the Line of Duty actor is as famous in Scotland as a pop icon.

item.title: Mystery orcas spotted in Scotland found in Norway
item.description: The pod of six killer whales photographed in a Norwegian fjord were last spotted off Vatersay in 2018.

item.title: Why are Scotland's emergency departments so busy?
item.description: The number of people turning up at emergency departments in Scotland is rising sharply, figures show.

item.title: 'My heart sank' - BBC Scotland's Olympics team forced to isolate in Tokyo
item.description: BBC Scotland's three-strong team are self-isolating in hotel rooms after a Covid case on their Japan flight.

item.title: Heatwaves: What do they do to the body and who is at risk?
item.description: What impact do high temperatures have on our bodies?

item.title: Glasgow rapper Oakzy B wants to be 'bigger than Burns'
item.description: Oakzy B is one of the contenders battling it out for a £50,000 prize in BBC Three's The Rap Game.

item.title: Man who lost wife and son in loch thought water 'looked safe'
item.description: A man who lost his wife and son in a drowning incident at Loch Lomond said the water had looked safe.

item.title: 'If it's broken, fix it' - The shop trying to fix throwaway culture
item.description: Glasgow social enterprise Remade Network fixes everything from phones to textiles to help reduce our impact on the environment.

item.title: 'To younger people these are alien objects'
item.description: An exhibition looking at the social and technological impact of typewriters opens at the National Museum of Scotland.

item.title: Martin Compston: 'It's an amazing period for the Scottish film industry'
item.description: Line of Duty star Martin Compston has been filming his new drama set on an oil rig in Edinburgh.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Andy Murray and Joe Salisbury advance in doubles and Liam Broady through
item.description: Andy Murray and Joe Salisbury reach the men's doubles quarter-finals while Liam Broady registers a stunning victory in the Tokyo Olympics singles.

item.title: Malmo beat HJK Helsinki to set up tie with Rangers
item.description: Swedish league leaders Malmo will meet Rangers in the Champions League third qualifying round after coming through 4-3 on aggregate against HJK Helsinki.

item.title: Leigh Griffiths: Celtic striker can 'win fans back', says manager Ange Postecoglou
item.description: Manager Ange Postecoglou says Leigh Griffiths can "win them back" after he was booed by some Celtic fans during Saturday's friendly defeat to West Ham.
